abstract: A fitting death, but a worrying one as well.
snippet: A fitting death, but a worrying one as well.
lead_paragraph: The lawless manner of Muammar el-Qaddafi's death - he was apparently beaten, dragged and shot by a mob of armed men in the streets of Surt - is well-fitted to the lawless way he ruled his country. Like Mussolini and Ceausescu, he perished by the same sword that he lived by. We should regret the absence of the fair trial that even the worst criminal deserves, but it's hard not to feel a certain mordant satisfaction at the ignominious way that one of recent history's genuine monsters passed to his reward. Thus always to tyrants ...
